critique: This executive order establishes the United States Sinai Support Mission to implement an early warning system in the Sinai following an agreement between Egypt and Israel. It primarily concerns foreign policy and national security. There's no direct impact on immigration, domestic economic regulation, or social inclusion within the US. The order delegates authority to the Director of the Mission and involves multiple agencies, suggesting a cooperative approach rather than a strong shift in federalism. It also grants waivers to certain legal provisions to facilitate the mission's operations.
